reviewText: I quite like the game as it is one of the very few Rugby games out there, it's certainly not perfect but it is a lot of fun.  The main issue I am encountering is CRASHING, it is constant and makes the game totally unplayable, very disappointed and am hoping for an update soon as I wish to spend more time playing!  Cannot reccomend at present as unplayable otherwise pretty fun for Rugby fans (although not the polished article).  3/10.\n\n**UPDATE** - Shall re-trial the game to see if I can get rid of the crashing issue and the report back. Original game was a lot of fun so hoping that re-installing will remedy the issue!

reviewText: This game had poor reviews but I thought it coudn't be as bad as everyone was saying, so gave it a chance, believe me IT IS WORSE than stated!!  Why would a game that is using the licenced logo of the rugby World cup not have the correct team lists?  Also I can't pass using my controller and there doesn't seem to be anywhere to change the controls.\n\nThis game cost $39.99, not worth it if it cost $3.99.  My advice is wait for Rugby Challenge 3!

reviewText:
♥♥♥♥ poor effort.
I thought I'd buy it purely because I've been itching to play a PC rugby game.

Team sheets are poor. No rugby game should have NZ or SA incomplete.
You would expect graphics to have moved on from the last world cup.
Gameplay is shoddy.

Waste of money.

Do not purchase, rather wait for Rugby Challenge 3.

reviewText: Thoroughly enjoying the game. Using a gamepad, which is working really well. The graphics are decent; the gameplay is fast-paced and enjoyable; and the controls work really well. It is easily the best rugby game I have played, despite the many negative reviews. Compared to other rugby games, this seems to give much more freedom to actually play rugby properly and to execute a fast-paced running game. The controls for rucking are another highlight, I believe, actually allowing for slight errors to result in penalties (as opposed to just deliberate actions).\nOne or two people have suggested that you may need a decent working knowledge of the sport to enjoy this game, and I can see how that could be true. Even so, I would still strongly recommend this game.
